words.definition: a bag you wear on your back, with straps over your shoulders
a container used for carrying money and small personal items or accessories (especially by women)
tight fitting garment worn for swimming
a coat that protects you from getting drenched in the rain
a thin piece of cloth that's knotted around the neck
an accessory you wear around your waist that helps hold your pants up
what you wear to help you see better if you have less than perfect eyesight
jewelry consisting of precious metal (often set with jewels) worn on the finger
a shirt or top usually worn by a woman
a piece of clothing that you wear on your hand, to protect it or keep it warm.
a wide piece of fabric that's worn around the neck or over the head
kind of shoe that can be as high as your knee
two-legged piece of clothing you wear on the bottom half of your body
jewelry worn around the wrist for decoration
headdress that protects the head from bad weather; has shaped crown and usually a brim
footwear shaped to fit the foot (below the ankle)
a lightweight or shorter version of a coat
trousers that end at or above the knee
a casual, collarless shirt
close-fitting trousers of heavy denim for manual work or casual wear
a garment hanging from the waist; worn mainly by girls and women
gizmo used to protect yourself from rain or sun
clothing in general, made of cloth or fabric
an accessory (as a bracelet or ring or necklace) made of precious metals and set with gems
a piece of clothing you wear on your foot, under your shoe, and usually come in pairs
a warm piece of clothing you wear when it's cold outside
a sleeveless dress resembling an apron; worn over other clothing
jacket and pants that match, well-suited for formal events
a pocket-size case for holding papers and paper money
glasses that are darkened to protect the eyes from the glare of the sun
a small portable device for keeping time
one-piece shirt and skirt combo that can be fancy or plain
crocheted or knitted garment covering the upper part of the body
jewelry you wear on your ear
